caption:
The photograph is framed through an opening, possibly a hole or tube, creating a vignette effect that focuses on a man seated at a control panel or desk. The image has a slightly punchy, vintage color palette, indicative of older film stock.

The man appears to be engaged in some kind of technical work, manipulating several knobs and buttons on a panel that has various meters and displays. He wears glasses and a dark sweater, seeming focused on his task. His workstation is cluttered with papers, hinting at detailed work or calculations.

In the background, there are electronic or mechanical devices that resemble a mix of receivers and filing equipment. The setting could be a laboratory or a specialist control room. The equipment appears dated, suggesting the photo could be from the mid-to-late 20th century.

The office furniture, such as chairs and desks, are made of wood, emphasizing an older, utilitarian office design. There's a minimalistic style to the room, with no personal objects or decorations visible, which could suggest a strictly professional environment focused on technical or scientific work.

Overall, the composition and focus on the man through the vignette effect creates a centered, almost portrait-like feel, emphasizing the manâ€™s interaction with the technology before him.
title: Technician at controls of "whole body counter" at EPA's National Environmental Research Center at Las Vegas
